snippet: The former judge, Elizabeth Butler-Sloss, said some groups cited concerns of a conflict of interest because her brother was attorney general in the 1980s.
abstract: Elizabeth Butler-Sloss, former senior judge asked to lead inquiry into child abuse allegations in Britain, steps down, citing concerns of conflict of interest because her brother Michael Havers was attorney general in the 1980s, when some of the abuse was alleged to have been covered up.
lead_paragraph: The former judge, Elizabeth Butler-Sloss, said some groups cited concerns of a conflict of interest because her brother was attorney general in the 1980s.

headline.main: Ex-Judge Leading Inquiry Into Child Abuse in Britain Steps Down
headline.print_headline: Britain: Head of Abuse Panel Quits
